Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'MySqlCommand.MySqlCommand(string, MySqlConnection)' in 'InsertaLecturaE.insertaLecturaL()' could contain the following variables 'd.t', 'd.t'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.
Implement IDisposable on 'ModParticipante' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'MySqlConnection'.

Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'MySqlCommand.MySqlCommand(string, MySqlConnection)' in 'ModParticipante.ActualizaP(Participante)' could contain the following variables 'p.nombre', 'p.id'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'MySqlCommand.MySqlCommand(string, MySqlConnection)' in 'ModParticipante.crearP(Participante)' could contain the following variables 'p.nombre', 'p.snumero'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Message.TypeName: Provide correct arguments to formatting methods
Message.Issue: Method 'CS461_HL_API.runIO_output(int, int, string)' calls 'string.Format(string, object, object, object)' and does not provide a format item for argument "1, 2, 3". The provided format string is: '"&mode=check"'

Provide an overridable implementation of Dispose(bool) on 'ShowWaitCursor' or mark the type as sealed. A call to Dispose(false) should only clean up native resources. A call to Dispose(true) should clean up both managed and native resources.
Modify 'ShowWaitCursor.Dispose()' so that it calls Dispose(true), then calls GC.SuppressFinalize on the current object instance ('this' or 'Me' in Visual Basic), and then returns.

Message.TypeName: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Message.Issue: Object 'client' can be disposed more than once in method 'TrustedServer.AcceptCallback(IAsyncResult)'. To avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.: Lines: 3842

Rule.TypeName: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Rule.Name: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Rule.Description: A correctly implemented Dispose method can be called multiple times without throwing an exception. However, this is not guaranteed and to avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.
Rule.Resolution: Object {0} can be disposed more than once in method {1}. To avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.: Lines: 3842

Rule.Name: Implement IDisposable correctly
Rule.Description: All IDisposable types should implement the Dispose pattern correctly.
Rule.Resolution: Modify {0} so that it calls Dispose(true), then calls GC.SuppressFinalize on the current object instance ('this' or 'Me' in Visual Basic), and then returns.

Provide an overridable implementation of Dispose(bool) on {0} or mark the type as sealed. A call to Dispose(false) should only clean up native resources. A call to Dispose(true) should clean up both managed and native resources.

Rule.TypeName: Provide correct arguments to formatting methods
Rule.Name: Provide correct arguments to formatting methods
Rule.Description: Provide the correct number of arguments to String.Format calls.
Rule.Resolution: Method {0} calls {1} and does not provide a format item for argument {2}. The provided format string is: '{3}'

Rule.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Name: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Description: A SQL command string built from user input is vulnerable to SQL injection attacks. Microsoft SQL Server and other database servers support stored procedures and parameterized SQL queries, which reduce the risk of injection attacks.
Rule.Resolution: The query string passed to {0} in {1} could contain the following variables {2}. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Rule.Name: Types that own disposable fields should be disposable
Rule.Description: Types that declare disposable members should also implement IDisposable. If the type does not own any unmanaged resources, do not implement a finalizer on it.
Rule.Resolution: Implement IDisposable on {0} because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: {1}.
